description: Demolition of existing rear building and excavation of site to facilitate the erection of a three-storey building (across basement, ground and first floor levels) to create a new residential unit and minor alterations to rear outrigger to create new access to existing unit from Broadway Mews.
decision_conditions: <p>In the event that a variation is proposed from the works hereby approved, as a result of discussions with Building Control and the requirement to meet Building Regulations, full details of the variations to the works shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the relevant part of the work commences on site. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area</p>

<p>No roof plant (including all external enclosures, machinery and other installations) shall be placed upon or attached to the roof or other external surfaces of the building.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>

<p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);"><br></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51);">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building.</p>

<p>All disturbed surfaces shall be made good using materials to match the existing materials, composition, form, finish and colour of the existing building.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the relevant works, a policy compliant cycle parking plan, which shows details of layout, foundation, stand type and spacing, of 2 cycle parking spaces, shall submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for the safe and secure storage of bicycles is made for future occupiers and in the interest of safeguarding highway safety.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of two Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of biodiversity.</p>

<p>No development shall commence, other than works of demolition, until a report (including intrusive investigation/trial pit and monitoring where necessary) demonstrating that the basement development will not increase the potential for groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. Details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance measures against surface water (overland flow) and groundwater (if identified) shall be submitted to the LPA for approval and the approved measures incorporated before the ground flood extension and basement is occupied. The basement shall be constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for "protection of below ground structures against water from the ground" and current best practice.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of flood risk mitigation.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of sustainable drainage.&nbsp;</p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>Detailed drawings and full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved:</p><p><br></p><p>a. Details of all new and replacement external windows and external doors;</p><p>b. Details of the external balcony railings;</p><p>c. Details of the fencing or other enclosures within the outdoor areas of the proposed mews house and the existing shop;</p><p>d. Details of the hard surfacing material within the outdoor areas of the proposed mews house and the existing shop;</p><p>e. Details of all external vents and flues including boiler flues and kitchen and bathroom extracts.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>

<p>Full details, including physical samples, of all the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including, but not limited to, the brickwork and coping stones of the proposed mews house, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work commences on site. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>

<p>No new grilles, satellite dishes, aerials, meter boxes, security alarms, lighting, security or other cameras or other fixtures or plant shall be mounted on the external faces or roof of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, plumbing, pipes, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>

<p>All new and replacement external rainwater and soil pipes shall be of traditional design, formed in cast iron and painted black.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the listed building and the conservation area.</p>
subdivision_of_building: Erection of the rear building and new staircase access to the existing residential unit.
